text:
March 30, 1967
Dr. Stewart Cooney
7625 Lurline Avenue
Canoga Park, California 91306
Dear Dr. Cooney:
It was a pleasure talking with you on the telephone
yesterday regarding the proposed Public Television
Act of 1967 and its implications for educational
radio.
As you requested, I am enclosing a "Care Package"
of pertinent materials including: a copy of the
proposed Public Television Act of 1967, a listing
of the Senate and House Commfinications Committee
members; various newspaper and magazine reprints dealÂ¬
ing with the problems of educational radio in the
United States; as well as some general material on
the National Association of Educational Broadcasters,
and our particular division, National Educational
Radio; examples of some of our recent program offerings,
an outline of the NER program service; an application
for membership; and some brochures on individual
programs.
I would be most interested to learn of any supportive
action you or Pacifica Foundation might take in
behalf of educational radio.
If, after looking over the enclosed, you have any
further questions, I would be happy to try to answer
them for you.
Sincerely,
Enclosures
Lucinda K. Landreth
Administrative Assistant
